body_html:
Since the behavior on GPU is drop_negative=True, and since (IIRC) the current behavior on CPU is an error, we are within our right to change the behavior on CPU to match GPU (drop_negative=True). I think this alone would address #478.

I do not know whether we would still want the extra argument. Does anyone require drop_negative=False (which does not result in an error)?
body_text:
Since the behavior on GPU is drop_negative=True, and since (IIRC) the current behavior on CPU is an error, we are within our right to change the behavior on CPU to match GPU (drop_negative=True). I think this alone would address #478.
I do not know whether we would still want the extra argument. Does anyone require drop_negative=False (which does not result in an error)?
body:
Since the behavior on GPU is `drop_negative=True`, and since (IIRC) the current behavior on CPU is an error, we are within our right to change the behavior on CPU to match GPU (`drop_negative=True`). I think this alone would address #478. 

I do not know whether we would still want the extra argument. Does anyone require `drop_negative=False` (which does not result in an error)?
